text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]T: P_4 \rightarrow \mathbb R^7[/mathjaxinline] be a linear transformation. What is the largest possible rank of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline]?
Is is possible for [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] to be onto?

font.p: The rank of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] plus the nullity of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] must equal the dimension of [mathjaxinline]P_4[/mathjaxinline], which is 5. Thus, the largest possible rank of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is 5, obtained if the nullity is 0 (i.e., if the kernel of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is trivial).

The transformation [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is onto if and only if the image is all of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^7[/mathjaxinline], which has dimension 7. But, the maximum dimension of the image is 5. Thus [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] cannot be onto.
